Noise simulation examples

2019-06-08

Source: vignettes/noise_simulations.Rmd
noise_simulations.Rmd

Simulating noise types (following this)

library(tuneR)

# White noise
w <- tuneR::noise(kind = c("white"))

# Brown noise is integrated white noise
# (ie. random walk)
# Use same time series length as in the other series
b <- cumsum(rnorm(length(w@left)))

# Pink noise
p <- tuneR::noise(kind = c("pink"))

# Visualize
par(mfrow=c(3,1))
plot(w,main="white noise")
plot(b,main="brown noise")
plot(p,main="pink noise")

Estimating Hurst exponent for the noises

library(pracma)
Hwhite <- hurstexp(w@left, d = 128)
## Simple R/S Hurst estimation:         0.5515158 
## Corrected R over S Hurst exponent:   0.5452616 
## Empirical Hurst exponent:            0.5135488 
## Corrected empirical Hurst exponent:  0.4983471 
## Theoretical Hurst exponent:          0.5155387
Hbrown <- hurstexp(b, d = 128)
## Simple R/S Hurst estimation:         0.9108255 
## Corrected R over S Hurst exponent:   1.01174 
## Empirical Hurst exponent:            1.011894 
## Corrected empirical Hurst exponent:  1.007858 
## Theoretical Hurst exponent:          0.5155387
Hpink <- hurstexp(p@left, d = 128)
## Simple R/S Hurst estimation:         0.8070514 
## Corrected R over S Hurst exponent:   0.9109027 
## Empirical Hurst exponent:            0.931535 
## Corrected empirical Hurst exponent:  0.9254818 
## Theoretical Hurst exponent:          0.5155387
